results.title: Xena: Warrior princess. Season 1. Eps. 01-02
results.brief_description: The first two episodes of the groundbreaking television series about Xena, a female warrior struggling to come to terms with her evil past, and Gabrielle, her faithful sidekick. Together the two women roam across ancient Greece, battling warlords and righting wrongs. Filmed on location in New Zealand, the series was created as a spinoff from the popular fantasy-action series ‘Hercules: The Legendary Journeys’. Highly postmodern in tone, the series mixes martial-arts-inspired action sequences with ‘camp’ humour, contemporary cultural references, and a wild disregard for historical accuracy. As a physically strong, independent woman, the character of Xena has been adopted as a feminist icon of popular culture. The implication within the subtext of the show that Xena and Gabrielle might be more than ‘just good friends’ has led many viewers to read the couple as lesbian lovers. In episode one, ‘Sins of the past’, Xena journeys homeward, determined to make amends for her past sins, but her efforts to begin a new life are challenged by the vengeful warlord, Draco. In episode two, ‘Chariots of war’, Xena is wounded after saving a young boy. Rescued by the boy’s father, she is taken into town to recuperate but many of the townsfolk are unhappy about her presence there.

results.title: Xena: Warrior Princess
results.brief_description: Xena is an infamous warrior on a quest to seek redemption for her past sins against the innocent. Accompanied by her comrade-in-arms Gabrielle, the couple use their formidable fighting skills to help those who are unable to defend themselves.

constellations_other.name: Boom mics, Clara Bow and musicals
constellations_other.description: The microphone was called the "terror of the studios" when sound films were introduced in the late 1920s, but after initial resistance Hollywood fully embraced the new technology.

results.title: Xanadu
results.creator_credit: Robert Greenwald, Lawrence Gordon and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Disco, rollerskates, ELO and 1940s meets 1980s courtesy of Olivia Newton-John and Gene Kelly combined in this cult, kitsch, musical fantasy. Kira (Olivia Newton-John) is a Greek muse despatched to Earth to inspire young artist, Sonny Malone (Michael Beck), realise his dream of starting up a disco rollerskating rink called Xanadu. She teams him up with Danny McGuire (Gene Kelly), an ex big club band member and former recipient of Kira’s magical influence. Sonny and Danny merge their styles and generations as Kira and Sonny challenge the laws of nature by falling in love. From this threadbare plot emerges a time capsule of 1980s music, fashion, and sensibility that has been simultaneously loved and loathed by viewers.

results.title: X-Ray Crystallography
results.brief_description: Explains the production and properties of X-rays, pointing out their similarities to, and differences from, light and other electro-magnetic radiation. The way in which crystals may be used as diffraction gratings for X-rays is shown

results.title: X-Men: the legend of Wolverine
results.brief_description: This DVD contains four colourful animation episodes of the made-for-television series of the “X-men” based on the Marvel comic books of the same name. The episodes all produced and directed by Larry Houston are: “Out of the past, part 1” where X-men discover a space ship underground that contains a great alien force and reunites old lovers (but now foes) of Wolverine with Urico (now cyborg Lady Death-strike); “Out of the past, part 2” where the space ship hull is opened and a evil alien force comes out fighting and captures peoples’ spirits with it; “Nightcrawler” where Wolverine ends up in a monastery while fighting an evil beast; “Lotus and the steel” where Wolverine conquers a sword wielding bad guy in Japan and saves the town as well as dealing with his past memories and mind re-programming. Extras include interviews with the creator, Stan Lee and writer, Chris Claremont, from Marvel.

constellations_other.name: My People
constellations_other.description: The breakout single for Sydney dance duo The Presets, 'My People' was one of the biggest hits of 2007 and propelled by the engaging music video.

results.title: X-Men [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Bryan Singer, Lauren Shuler and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: The concentration camps of World War 2 is an unlikely place to start this faithful film adaptation of the long running Marvel comic series. Director Bryan Singer however quickly makes the connection apparent as this tale of difference and intolerance unfolds. Set mainly in an unspecified future, ‘X-Men’ sets up the premise that human evolution has taken un unexpected leap when various children are born with a gene that mutates into extraodinary super powers. These special beings however are met with suspicion and fear by the wider community, in particular by right wing Senator Robert Kelly (Bruce Davison), who wants to register the much maligned ‘mutants’. Singer carefully introduces us into the labyrinth world of the X-men by following the plight of shy teenager, Marie D’Acanto (Anna Paquin), who discovers, much to her horror, that she has the power to absorb the life out of anyone she touches. Through her we meet Wolverine (Hugh Jackman), a dangerous loner who, when provoked, protrudes steel blades out of his knuckles, as well as meeting the rest of the X-men who reside in a special school set up by the wheel chair bound and telepathic Professor Xavier (Patrick Stewart). Of course every super hero must have it’s villain, and a powerful foe is created in the mysterious and tormented Magnetto (Ian McKellen), a mutant who has the ability to harness magnetic energy and wants to start a war between the intolerant humans and the mutants. Cast also includes Halle Berry, Famke Janssen, James Marsden, Rebecca Romjin-Stamos and Ray Park.
